name: Old Bahama Bay

reviews.text: Went to Old Bahama Bay for a few days. Overall the resort is very nice and relaxing. It will help others to know the realities so they know what they are getting.
reviews.title: My honest impression
Best Hotel On Grand Bahama Island!!!
reviews.text: The Good: Rooms are big and beautifully furnished. Housekeeping was great. Our room had a small wet bar/fridge/microwave/coffee maker that we found handy.
The beach and the water are beautiful -- very clear but watch those currents!!!
reviews.title: Nice getaway!
Pampering Care in a Surrounding of Unspoiled Beauty
reviews.text: The staff are friendly and helpful.
But there are a few caveats: This place is very far from Freeport/Lucaya so you are in an isolated setting. You can rent a car from the resort but it is a good 45-minute drive to Freeport.
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff but that's it.

reviews.text: We just got back from Old Bahama Bay where we had our wedding and honeymoon. We went to Old Bahama Bay with 18 family members and everyone is still talking about the wonderful time that they had and what a great location it was.
reviews.title: What a Place!!!!!

reviews.text: I do not know if I can put into words how wonderful the staff at Old Bahama Bay is. We were treated like royality the entire time that we were there. It truly was the staff that made our trip the best wedding ever!!! The resort was beautiful, but when we go back, I look forward to seeing the staff that made our trip great.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Inn on a Beautiful Beach

reviews.text: From the front desk staff to the staff that was working in every aspect of the resort, I can not say anything but kind words about of them. They greeted us every time with a hello and a smile, no matter what we were asking for.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.text: Keith Cooper was excellent with offering advice and suggestions from the very beginning.
reviews.title: Beautiful, But Bugged!
Beautiful but Flawed
reviews.text: Erica Heild was an excellent wedding coordinator with nothing but a friendly word and support every step of the way.

reviews.title: 8 Days at Old Bahama Bay
reviews.text: Old Bahama Bay is a 40 minute drive from the airport and Lacaya. The drive from the airport evidences poverty and damage to properties because of the hurricanes. The resort would be well advised to offer water transportation - as the drive to me was very depressing.

reviews.title: Low Key Vacation
reviews.text: Upon arriving at Old Bahama Bay - I was encouraged. The resort is pretty, well maintained - the marina full of lovely boats and the 2 bedroom suite was well appointed. Our kitchen had a microwave, cooktop, fridge, coffee maker and toaster. However, no pots and pans or can openers with which to cook. The Master bedroom and bath were beautiful - two porches - one overlooking the beach and water and another overlooking the marina. The room was on a par with Four Seasons - absolutely wonderful.
Service - repeatedly needed to request coffee and the like to be restocked. Repeatedly, there were insufficient towels and face clothes - it was we'll get them to you by 7PM.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon!!!
A little piece of paradise!!!!
reviews.text: There are three restaurants. The beachfront restaurant and dockside restaurant are both good. I feel the menu dockside could be improved upon with a fresh catch of the day - I ate blackened grouper 4 out of eight nights. Aqua was just flat out awful. We gave it two tries - both were dismal - lobster was over cooked (badly) both times and steak appeared to have been microwaved both times.

reviews.title: Bug city
reviews.text: Activities were good - volleyball on the beach, sailing, snorkeling - BUT with six in our family - three out of six had to be treated for reactions to bug bites - I have never seen anthing like it. The no see ems and horse flies were extreme and sadly resulted in 2 of the six requiring a cream that could only be supplied by pharmacy and 40 minute drive. The resort did not stock it - and with the bug problem - there is not one ounce of exaggeration - it is a problem - we have traveled the world - and the black flies in spring in northern Ontario have nothing on these no see ems.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I made one final escape to the warm climates before our true winter hits. We manage to get an inexpensive package through ---.com as well as cheap flights on Delta.
reviews.title: Great potential

likes.liked: — The rooms, the food at Aqua and the fitness facility.
likes.disliked: — The construction noise, the flies, and the breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived in Freeport and then whisked away to the resort (about a 35 minute drive), we noticed the extreme damage Frances and Jeanne had done two hurricane seasons ago. However, the island seemed to be kicking back swiftly but as I'll get to, it may take a few years to get fully restored (especially the trees).
reviews.title: Enjoy Grand Bahama one way, the Old Bahama Bay way

reviews.text: In any event, we arrived at the resort with a somewhat unceremonial greeting (didn't they send a car to pick us up?). After finally getting a king-bed room (which we had asked for), we quickly enjoyed the final few hours of sunlight with a walk around the resort.
reviews.title: Old Bahama Bay was Truly Amazing

likes.liked: — The room is outstanding and has an incredible view.

reviews.text: Unfortunately, this walk took about 5 minutes. As previously mentioned, the hurricanes made a direct hit on the West End and the resort's surrounding area is just rebuilding. This is not a knock on the resort itself (stay in the Phase 2 buildings), the small and coral sand beach, pool, gym, food at Aqua - all were great. But we like to be a little more adventurous and it was tough to see the town of the West End in rough shape. And we were surprised that the resort hasn't undergone better replanting of vegetation in the area. The hard coral rock ground outside the resort is not very romantic.
reviews.title: Peaceful and relaxing vacation!
Relaxation at its best
reviews.text: And it was hard to believe that there really is no beach around the island, besides what was made at the resort. (If you want to sit on the beach and do next to nothing, this is the place for you). The resort, which comprises of a huge marina, is selling ocean lots and putting more of the effort into selling and building homes. In addition, they are building a couple of golf courses next to the resort. Given that, we constantly heard back hoes, earth movers and pounding of nails. (If you have ever been to Dubai recently, you know what I mean). And there is still much to be cleaned up as well. All this work and we're afraid another big storm will wipe it out again.

aka: Old Bahama Bay Hotel Grand Bahama Island
description: Old Bahama Bay Resort & Yacht Harbour is the ultimate getaway for tranquility and relaxation. Combining Bahamian charm and barefoot elegance, the resort features 73 spacious beachfront suites, full-service marina, Stuart Cove Dive Operation, fishing and other excursions. Resort amenities include 2 restaurants and bars, paddleboards, kayaks, snorkel equipment and much more.
